result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua David Micke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua David Micke

defendant.name: Micke, Joshua David
defendant.address: N4070 E Lake Ln, White Lake, WI 54491

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua David Micke in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Joshua David Micke in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF80, 15CF88, 15CF144, 15CF162, 14CM220 and 15CM143  Called at 9:21 pm.  15CF88 Ct 4, def entered a plea, statement by Atty Bayne-Allison.  State will move to dismiss ct 4.  No objection by Atty Goetz.  Court will dismiss ct 4 in 15CF88.  PSI correction 15CF162 def entered plea to Ct 1 & 3  Jeff Johnson, alternative PSI author duly sworn on oath, testifies.   Atty Bayne-Allison checks on victim rights notification.  Recess 9:48 am  Reconvene 9:54 am  Victim rights have been complied with.  State presents sentencing arguments.  State requesting 15CF88 prison 4 yrs, 2 initial & 2 yr. extended  15CF144 prison, initial conf and extended.  15CF162 withhold sentence, 3 yrs probation consecutive   Balance of charges, state request court to follow the PSI report.  Atty Goetz presents sentencing arguments.  Requesting court to follow the recommendations in alternative PSI report.  Statement by def.  Sentencing remarks by court.  15CF80 Ct 1 - Sentence withheld, 1 yr probation.  10 days jail  court cost.  DNA surcharge$200. Cr 4 days if revoked.  Huber privileges.  Ct4 - Sentence withheld 1 yr probation concurrent.  10 days jail, huber cost  & $200. surcharge.  Ct 5 Sentence 1 yrs probation.  30 days jail.  Cost & DNA $200 surcharge.  Jail sentences are all consecutive.  15CF144 Ct 1 - sentence 1 yr probation concurrent with previous.  30 days jail, consecutive.  Court cost, & DNA $200 surcharge  Credit 10 days if revoked.  Ct 2 - 1 yr probation, sentence withheld  30 days jail, consecutive.  Court cost & DNA surcharge $250.  Concurrent with ct 1.  15CM143 - Court cost & DNA surcharge and $300.00 restitution.   15CF88 Ct 1 - Sentence 1 yr probation, concurrent.  10 days jail,  huber.  Credit 6 days if revoked.  Court cost & DNA surcharge $200.  Jail term consecutive.  15CF162 Ct 1 - Sentence 1 year probation concurrent.  30 days jail, huber   Credit 9 days if revoked.  Court cost & DNA surcharge $250.  Ct3 1 yr probation 30 days jail,  huber cost & DNA 200.  14CM220 Ct 1 Sentence withheld 1 yr probation  30 days jail, huber  Court cost.  No DNA surcharge.  Ct 3 withheld sentence 1 yr probation  10 days jail,  huber.  Cost No DNA surcharge.  All sentences are withheld with probation.  Felony conviction rights reviewed.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Post conviction rights   Court reviews bonds.  All bonds that were ordered forfeited shall be forfeited $1000., $5000., and $750.00  Bond of 1500 to be applied towards cost in that case, then to oldest case for cost.  15CF160 State request proof of restitution paid to CoVantage,  Per Atty Goetz def was charged in Marathon County.  14CM169 case was dismissed, holding $500.00, to be returned to poster.   State requesting restitution be paid first from $1500.00, cost from bond and then restitution.  15FO201 - outstanding fine $200.50 to be taken from bond.

Defendant Joshua David Micke in court & in custody with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 3:06 pm. State gives plea agreement, plea to charge, complied with victim rights & order PSI & 300.00 Restitution free to argue. Parties agree with plea agreement. Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights filed. Criminal Damage to Property, no contest plea.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Def. understands elements. Atty Goetz is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given. Stipulate to factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty to Criminal Damage to Property. Court orders PSI & to be filed by 4-8-16.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF144, 15CF80, 15CF88, 15CM143, 14CM169, 14CM220, 15CF160 and 15CF162 @ 10:15 a.m. Atty Laufenberg makes statement, asks to withdraw from all cases he is currently on due to conflict of interest. Has advised Def. in writing. Def was aware cases were going to be called today. Public Defender's office is appointing Atty Paul Goetz. Court grants motion to withdraw on all. Court will send notice to Atty Goetz to appear in person on 9/14/15.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua David Micke in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CM169, 14CM220, 15CF80, 15CF88, 15CM143 @ 11:35 a.m. Atty Laufenberg notes special appearance. Received 15CM143, reading waived, not guilty plea, reserve all juris. objections. 15CF80 and15CF88 received, reading waived, prelim hrgs requested with time limits waived.  Ask 14CM220 and 14CM169 be adjourned to track along with new files. 15CF80 - Court reviews time limit waiver with Def. 14CM143 - plea received. 15CF88 - Court reviews time limit waiver with Def. Def agrees with adjourning 14CM169 and 14CM220. State heard on bond for 15CM143, requests $500 signature with conditions. No objection. Court addresses bond with Def. $500 signature bond. No use of alcohol. No contact with BP South.  All cases set for status or prelims  on 8/26/15 @ 10:00 a.m. If new counsel appointed, to advise Court right away if new date needed. Def advised to report for booking.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
